summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Liberia,
Welcoming Liberia's progress in rebuilding with international support,
Noting the UN Panel of Experts' report (S/2015/558) and the Secretary-General's letter (S/2015/590) on Liberia's progress,
Commending Liberia's response to the Ebola outbreak and recognizing its resilience,
Welcoming international support, including the UN, AU, and ECOWAS,
Affirming Liberia's primary responsibility to protect its population from atrocities,
Stressing the need for security sector reform and effective management of natural resources,

Decides to:
1. Renew arms measures for 9 months,
2. Terminate travel and financial measures,
3. Extend the Panel of Experts' mandate for 10 months to:
    (a) Investigate and report on arms measures implementation and violations,
    (b) Provide a final report by 1 May 2016,
    (c) Cooperate with other panels of experts,
4. Request the Secretary-General to re-establish the Panel of Experts.
Here is a summarized version of the document:

2237 (2015)

The Security Council:

Decides to extend the mandate of the Panel of Experts to 1 member for 10 months;

 Calls on all States, including Liberia, to cooperate with the Panel of Experts;

 Recalls that Liberia's government is responsible for controlling small arms circulation;

 Urges Liberia to adopt and implement arms and ammunition management legislation;

 Affirms its readiness to adjust measures in response to Liberia's stability;

 Decides to remain seized of the matter.
